message_1: What is the largest even integer that cannot be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers?
message_2: The largest even integer that cannot be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers is 2. This is because 2 is the smallest even number and also a prime number, and there are no other prime numbers that can be added to it to result in an even number. All other even numbers greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers, according to the Goldbach Conjecture. Although the Goldbach Conjecture has not been proven, it has been tested extensively for even numbers up to very large values, and no counterexamples have been found.
